name: PubSub
overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Pub/Sub.

google-cloud is deprecated

Due to the scope of our API rapidly increasing, you may notice a decrease in performance if you continue to use the bundled module, `google-cloud`.

Going forward, please install only the individual service modules that you need, such as google-cloud.

The instructions below are here for reference, however, we will soon stop releasing updates to the bundled package.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloudâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var pubsub = gcloud.pubsub();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var pubsub = gcloud.pubsub({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: PubSub
methods.description:
Cloud Pub/Sub is a reliable, many-to-many, asynchronous messaging service from Cloud Platform.

The PUBSUB_EMULATOR_HOST environment variable from the gcloud SDK is honored, otherwise the actual API endpoint will be used.

params.name: options
params.description: • Configuration object.

methods.name: createTopic
methods.description: Create a topic with the given name.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: name
params.description: • Name of the topic.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error from the API call, may be null.

params.name: callback.topic
params.description: • The newly created topic.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response from the service.

methods.name: getSubscriptions
methods.description:
Get a list of the subscriptions registered to all of your project's topics. You may optionally provide a query object as the first argument to customize the response.

Your provided callback will be invoked with an error object if an API error occurred or an array of pubsub/subscription objects.

To get subscriptions for a topic, see pubsub/topic.

examples.caption: To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options
params.description: • Configuration object.

params.name: options.autoPaginate
params.description: • Have pagination handled automatically. Default: true.

params.name: options.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: • Maximum number of results to return.

params.name: options.pageSize
params.description: • Maximum number of results to return.

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: • Page token.

params.name: options.topic
params.description: • The name of the topic to list subscriptions from.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error from the API call, may be null.

params.name: callback.subscriptions
params.description: • The list of subscriptions in your project.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response from the service.

methods.name: getSubscriptionsStream
methods.description: Get a list of the pubsub/subscription objects registered to all of your project's topics as a readable object stream.

examples.caption: If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: options
params.description: • Configuration object. See pubsub#getSubscriptions for a complete list of options.

methods.name: getTopics
methods.description: Get a list of the topics registered to your project. You may optionally provide a query object as the first argument to customize the response.

examples.caption: To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: query
params.description: • Query object.

params.name: options.autoPaginate
params.description: • Have pagination handled automatically. Default: true.

params.name: options.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: • Maximum number of results to return.

params.name: query.pageSize
params.description: • Max number of results to return.

params.name: query.pageToken
params.description: • Page token.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error from the API call, may be null.

params.name: callback.topics
params.description: • The list of topics returned.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response from the service.

methods.name: getTopicsStream
methods.description: Get a list of the pubsub/topic objects registered to your project as a readable object stream.

examples.caption: If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: query
params.description: • Configuration object. See pubsub#getTopics for a complete list of options.

methods.name: subscribe
methods.description:
Create a subscription to a topic.

All generated subscription names share a common prefix, autogenerated-.

examples.caption: Subscribe to a topic. (Also see pubsub/topic#subscribe).
Omit the name to have one generated automatically. All generated names share a common prefix, autogenerated-.
Customize the subscription.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: topic
params.description: • The Topic to create a subscription to.

params.name: subName
params.description: • The name of the subscription. If a name is not provided, a random subscription name will be generated and created.

params.name: options
params.description: • See a Subscription resource

params.name: options.ackDeadlineSeconds
params.description: • The maximum time after receiving a message that you must ack a message before it is redelivered.

params.name: options.autoAck
params.description: • Automatically acknowledge the message once it's pulled. (default: false)

params.name: options.encoding
params.description: • When pulling for messages, this type is used when converting a message's data to a string. (default: 'utf-8')

params.name: options.interval
params.description: • Interval in milliseconds to check for new messages. (default: 10)

params.name: options.maxInProgress
params.description: • Maximum messages to consume simultaneously.

params.name: options.pushEndpoint
params.description: • A URL to a custom endpoint that messages should be pushed to.

params.name: options.timeout
params.description: • Set a maximum amount of time in milliseconds on an HTTP request to pull new messages to wait for a response before the connection is broken.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

params.name: callback.subscription
params.description: • The subscription.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response.

exceptions.description: If a Topic instance or topic name is not provided.

methods.name: subscription
methods.description:
Create a Subscription object. This command by itself will not run any API requests. You will receive a pubsub/subscription object, which will allow you to interact with a subscription.

All generated names share a common prefix, autogenerated-.

params.name: name
params.description: • The name of the subscription. If a name is not provided, a random subscription name will be generated.

params.name: options
params.description: • Configuration object.

params.name: options.autoAck
params.description: • Automatically acknowledge the message once it's pulled. (default: false)

params.name: options.encoding
params.description: • When pulling for messages, this type is used when converting a message's data to a string. (default: 'utf-8')

params.name: options.interval
params.description: • Interval in milliseconds to check for new messages. (default: 10)

params.name: options.maxInProgress
params.description: • Maximum messages to consume simultaneously.

params.name: options.timeout
params.description: • Set a maximum amount of time in milliseconds on an HTTP request to pull new messages to wait for a response before the connection is broken.

methods.name: topic
methods.description: Create a Topic object. See pubsub/createTopic to create a topic.

params.name: name
params.description: • The name of the topic.
